name: Ware Gibson
des: Vaux Bicycles belong to a premium category that conceptualizes before manufacturing, imagines before executing and tests before innovating. Narrowing the gap between functionality and bike art, Vaux strikes the fine balance for Cycling enthusiasts. We got the opportunity to test ride the Vaux Joggers and here is what I thought.

name: Latisha House
des: The Vaux Joggers is built on a strong and sturdy Alloy frame. Fat bikes do require ample amount of material on the frame to handle the bulky tires and the rough terrains it has to endure. The frame geometry on the Joggers ensured the riding posture was comfortable on the back, elbows and wrists.

name: Webster Thompson
des: This Fat Bike which I test rode came in a full Blue coloured frame with Fluorescent Green as the secondary colours for the decals and graphics. The graphics are minimal yet stylish. The seat tube has a unique dual tube design and it joins the bottom bracket which looks good and makes the bicycle look big. The fat tires have an artistic tread pattern.

name: Hester Pena
des: The Joggers from Vaux comes equipped with Shimano Tourney TZ500 at the front and rear as derailleurs with a 3x7-Speed gear combination. These derailleurs are entry-level MTB components and performed well during the test ride. The gear shifting was smooth with no lags during the test ride.

name: Hamilton Nielsen
des: The Mechanical Disc brakes from Sparkle on the Joggers Fat Bicycle are a great component for braking on the roughest of surfaces. Even though the wheelset is heavy, these brakes are quick to react and felt balanced as well.

name: Henrietta Hardin
des: The handlebar was perfect in length and made sure the rider is comfortable and finds it easy to turn the heavy wheels on both roads, sand and flat trails.
